results.title: New sounds in music
results.creator_credit: Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Presents fascinating new sounds and new ways of treating old sounds. Chance music, tape music, synthesiser music, and other 20th century approaches are heard. Some newly invented string and percussion instruments are demonstrated and finally we go to the Mills College Tape Music Center for a presentation involving new instruments, musicians and “new” music.

results.title: New romance
results.creator_credit: Janet Walczewski, Susan Gabori, Bill Brind and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Finely drawn study of the social aspects of heterosexual and homosexual relationships and asks whether people have a right to think, feel and act differently. Excellent use of locational interviews, cartoons and meaningful dialogue and opens up a subject that is often misunderstood.

results.title: New pulse of life - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Robert Berk, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Presents latest basic life support principles and techniques for cardiopulmonary resuscitation, as recommended by the National Research Council. Live subjects, mannequins, audio visual aids and animation are used to demonstrate A - Airway opened, B - Breathing restored and C - Circulation restored. Physiological background and dramatic CPR re-enactments are provided. The revised version does not contain a demonstration of the precordial thump or a witnessed cardiac arrest. The precordial thump should only be used in conjunction with an ECG monitoring machine.

results.title: New nation in the West Indies. Part 1. Background to federation
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill, Nicholas Balla and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part one of New Nation in the West Indies is an introduction to the Federation of the West Indies. Ten palm-shaded island units, popularly regarded as tourist paradises, have pooled their resources for a common future. What are their problems, hopes and aspirations as they embark on this new chapter in their history? The film presents the views of several spokesmen, notably Hugh Springer, Registrar of the University College of the West Indies, and the Honorable Norman Manley, Chief Minister of Jamaica, who describes the historical, political and economic motivations that led to the union.

results.title: New look for Naledi: upgrading a squatter settlement
results.creator_credit: Tina Viljoen, Barrie Howells and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Photographed on location in Botswana, this film examines the upgrading of Naledi, a squatters’ settlement on the outskirts of Gabarone. Originally a collection of tin shacks and dilapidated lean-tos, Naledi was gradually improved through local government and CIDA-sponsored self-help programs whereby residents were given repayable loans in the form of building materials. While to foreign eyes the settlement may suggest more despair than progress, Naledi now has clean water, sanitation, roads, drainage and street lighting, and is considered a model of African settlement upgrading.

results.title: New life for a Spanish farmer
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and Public Media
results.brief_description: Follows a Spanish farmer as he moves from arid land once belonging to his ancestors to an agricultural project sponsored by the government where he is given a plot of land and is taught new techniques of farming.
